item.title: Google’s TPUs May Deliver ‘Impressive’ Performance, But One Overlooked Bottleneck Could Bring External Scaling to a Halt Before It Even Begins
item.description:
Google's TPUs have made headlines across the AI world, following reports of external adoption; however, there's an angle to this that might prove to be a significant constraint. Google's 'Ironwood' AI Chips Are Seeing Immense Market Spotlight, But There's a Problem With This The interest around ASICs is massive in today's world of AI computing, mainly since it is believed that in the next layer of AI application, which is inferencing, chips like Google's TPUs will dominate with better TCOs and performance capabilities. Following the introduction of Google's 7th-generation Ironwood TPUs, companies like Meta and Anthropic showed interest in integrating […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/google-tpu-may-deliver-impressive-performance-but-one-overlooked-bottleneck-could-bring-external-scaling-to-a-halt/

item.title: CAFC Gives Targeted Ads Patent Owner Another Shot at Meta Due to District Court Error
item.description:
The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit (CAFC) on Friday vacated and remanded a district court’s decision in favor of Meta, rejecting the court’s finding that patent owner Adnexus had failed to state a plausible claim for direct infringement. The decision was precedential and authored by Judge Stark, with whom Judges Taranto and Prost joined.

The post CAFC Gives Targeted Ads Patent Owner Another Shot at Meta Due to District Court Error appeared first on IPWatchdog.com | Patents & Intellectual Property Law.

item.title: Apple's chief chip architect for the last decade has reportedly talked to CEO Tim Cook about leaving
item.description: Johny Srouji, the man behind development of Apple's processors in the latest iPhones, Macs, and Watches, is reportedly pondering leaving the company.

item.title: Samsung’s 4nm Process Has Witnessed Yield Improvements In The 60-70% Range, Enabling It To Reportedly Win A $100 Million Order To Develop An Omni Processing Unit For A U.S. Firm
item.description:
The struggles experienced by Samsung’s foundry business could be on their way out because the 4nm process, which was previously said to be a nightmare for the Korean giant, is slowly stabilizing, with the latest report mentioning a 60-70 percent yield range. This improvement has landed a major order for Samsung on its older technology, with a U.S. firm requiring an Omni Processing Unit (OPU) and having pre-ordered more than $100 million of these chips. The 4nm node has haunted Samsung due to less-than-stellar yields, but improving its older-generation processes can bring it closer to achieving profitability for the foundry […]

Read full article at https://wccftech.com/samsung-4nm-yields-improvement-lands-100-million-order-to-make-omni-processing-unit/

item.title: The iPhone 18 may finally add a camera feature that Samsung introduced on its flagship phones in 2021
item.description: Apple has long been rumored to be adding an under-display camera to the iPhone, and it could happen in 2026.

item.title: With one small step for AI, Chinese scientists make giant leap for humanity
item.description: Imagine a robot that could tie your shoelaces to the perfect degree of tightness, or a robotic hand capable of performing abdominal surgery and then suturing the wound with impeccable precision. You might assume these feats would rely on complex electronic sensors, and yet a breakthrough by Chinese scientists has made it possible for robots to rival the skill of experienced surgeons – even with their “eyes closed” – using just a simple knot. The achievement, by an interdisciplinary team from...
